item.description:
This is one in a series of presentations that Phillip Werner, a co-organizer with us, will be making this year.

=====

Built by the Green Mountain Club between 1910 and 1930, the Long Trail is the oldest long-distance trail in the United States. With its 273-mile footpath and nearly 70 primitive shelters, it was the inspiration for the Appalachian Trail, and offers pristine backcountry hiking opportunities for day hikers, weekend, and long distance backpackers. In this talk, Philip will describe the special challenges of hiking the Long Trail, which is notorious for its mud and rainy weather, and will display photos of landscape, animals, mountains, and sights along this wilderness trail. Philip completed an End-to-End hike of The Long Trail in 2008 and volunteers as a Green Mountain Club Mentor for backpackers preparing to hike the Long Trail.

While you can sign-up here on our site to coordinate with other randomites you will need to register for the class by visiting the REI event page by clicking here. Attendance is free.

Store Location

REI - Reading
279 Salem Street (exit 40 off Route 128)
Reading, MA 01867

Phone: (781) 944-5103

=====

Philip also publishes a blog called Section Hiker - Hiking and Backpacking for Beginners and Experts.
item.name: Hiking The Long Trail in Vermont (Educational Series)
